name: Hoe via Hoe Rough Circular Walk

ai.summary: A 13.5 km circular hike around Hoe Rough, featuring rough terrain, open moorland and countryside views. Moderate in difficulty, suitable for hikers with some experience and good boot grip.
ai.terrain_summary: Rough, uneven paths with potential boggy moorland sections; exposed open terrain in higher areas; stiles or gate crossings and some rocky footing. Navigation remains straightforward but visibility can reduce it.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in the UK can change quickly; check the forecast before you start. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and appropriate clothing. Carry a map and compass or GPS, plus a fully charged phone. Stay on marked paths, watch for mud and cattle gates, and inform someone of your planned return. Bring water, snacks, and a basic first aid kit. In exposed sections be prepared for wind and cold.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged mobile phone (and power bank)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn; the route can be done year-round with proper gear, but winter conditions may make it more challenging.
